abstract: By finishing in third place at Suzuka, Japan, Vettel became the youngest driver to win back-to-back drivers' championships in the series.
snippet: By finishing in third place at Suzuka, Japan, Vettel became the youngest driver to win back-to-back drivers' championships in the series.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: National Assn of Stock Car Auto Racing

lead_paragraph: At the Abu Dhabi Grand Prix last year, Sebastian Vettel, then 23, simultaneously won a race and a season championship. At the Japanese Grand Prix on Sunday, Vettel finished third at more than two seconds off the winning pace, yet with four races left on the Formula One calendar, Vettel, now 24, has drained the 2011 season of most, if not all of its drama by clinching his second championship in a row.

headline.main: Monday Motorsports: Sebastian Vettel Is Youngest Repeat Champion in Formula One History
